remarks: Define the equivalence relation predicate.  Our notation is not standard. A formal notation doesn't seem to exist in the literature; instead only informal English tends to be used.  The present definition, although somewhat cryptic, nicely avoids dummy variables.  In ~ dfer2 we derive a more typical definition.  We show that an equivalence relation is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive in ~ erref , ~ ersymb , and ~ ertr . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-1995.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Nov-2015.)
